intro: Cyrtandra tuiwawae, commonly known as the Kauai tamanu, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Kauai. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and streamside areas. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and is often found in the understory of native forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
